lead_paragraph: The school, which in 1838 profited from the sale of 272 slaves, plans to award preferential status in the admissions process to descendants of slaves.

headline.print_headline: Georgetown Plans Steps to Atone for Slave Past
headline.main: Georgetown University Plans Steps to Atone for Slave Past

snippet: The school, which in 1838 profited from the sale of 272 slaves, plans to award preferential status in the admissions process to descendants of slaves....
abstract: Georgetown University president John J DeGioia announces number of measures institution will take to address revelations it benefited from slavery and more specifically profited from sale of 272 slaves in 1838; DeGioia says descendants of those slaves will have preferential status in admissions process, and additionally that he will offer formal apology and create institute that will focus on study of slavery, among other measures.
